intro: Thrinax maritima, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and the southern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. The plant has dark green,革质 (leathery) leaves and produces showy yellow flowers with red centers. It is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate periodic inundation by seawater. Thrinax maritima plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various small animals and insects.
